text: The year 1669 in music involved some significant events. ==Events== *February 17 – Première of Alessandro Melani's opera L'empio punito at the Teatro di Palazzo Colonna in Rome. The work was commissioned by Marie Mancini. ==Publications== *Giovanni Maria Bononcini – Op. 3, a collection of sonatas in canon *Johann Caspar Kerll – Delectus sacrarum cantionum, 26 motets for 2–5 voices, 2 violins and basso continuo *Henry Lawes – Select Ayres and Dialogues *Samuel Capricornus – Scelta musicale *Giovanni Antonio Pandolfi – Sonate cioè balletti, sarabande, correnti, passacagli, capricetti e una trombetta... *Maurizio Cazzati – Varii, e diversi capricci per camera, Op. 50 == Classical music == *Johann Schmelzer – Sonata a 4, La Carolietta ==Opera== *Francesco Cavalli – Coriolano *Antonio Cesti – Genserico *Antonio Draghi – Achille in Sciro *Henri Dumont – Cinq messes en plain-chant *Jean-Baptiste Lully – Monsieur de Pourceaugnac, LWV 41 ==Births== *February 2 – Louis Marchand, organist, harpsichordist and composer (died 1732) *August 24 – Alessandro Marcello, composer (died 1747) *October 10 – Johann Nicolaus Bach, composer (died 1753) ==Deaths== *April 17 – Antonio Bertali, violinist and composer (born 1605) *May? – Étienne Richard, composer, organist and harpsichordist (born c.1621) *October 14 – Antonio Cesti, opera composer (born 1623) *date unknown **Richard Ayleward, musician and composer (born 1626) **Christopher Simpson, viola da gamba player and composer (born c.1605) *probable – Étienne Moulinié, composer (born c.1600)
title: 1669 in music
